Key Match Events: Bobby Portis delivered his best performance of the season, tallying 21 points and 18 rebounds.
Damian Lillard showcased his scoring prowess, putting up 36 points along with seven assists.
A costly half-court violation by the Bucks led to a Darius Garland three-pointer in the final seconds.
Post-Match Reflections: The Bucks showed resilience but falling short by just two points highlights how a fully healthy lineup could make a difference in these close contests.
The narrow loss to Cleveland suggests the Bucks might not be too far off from where they want to be.
If the Bucks can get healthy, there's reason to believe they can turn things around.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Bucks have had a tough early schedule, playing five of their first seven games on the road.
Eight of their next ten games will be at home, which could give them the boost they need to reset and gain some momentum.
